title: Two Oxford AI experts awarded prestigious fellowships
description: Two Oxford academics are among 28 global researchers awarded prestigious fellowships to shape the future of artificial intelligence
content:
Professor Philip Torr and Dr Christian Schroeder de Witt, both from Oxford University’s Department of Engineering Science, have been named AI2050 Research Fellows by Schmidt Sciences.

title: China stocks flat as consumer staples, liquor gains counter tech losses
description: ** Weighing on broader markets on Monday, the artificial intelligence sector index slid nearly 3% to a more than two-week low and the chip sector index weakened 1.3% as a correction for global tech shares continued over valuation concerns. ** The U.S. Senate moved forward with a measure aimed at reopening the federal government and ending a 40-day shutdown that has caused an unprecedented economic data blackout.
content:
China stocks struggled for direction on Monday as gains in defensive sectors including liquor and consumer staples on rising consumer prices countered losses in tech shares.

title: The AI revolution has a power problem
description: Echoing the 1990s dotcom frenzy to build Internet infrastructure, today's tech giants are spending unprecedented sums to construct the silicon backbone of the revolution in artificial intelligence.
content:
SAN FRANCISCO: In the race for AI dominance, American tech giants have the money and the chips, but their ambitions have hit a new obstacle: electric power.

title: UK firms plan 3% pay rises in coming year, see AI hit to jobs, survey shows
description: British employers expect to raise wages by 3% in the next 12 months, but some recruiters expect artificial intelligence to shrink their workforce, according to a survey that showed firms were worried about the impact of government tax plans on hiring.

title: One in six employers expect job cuts from AI in next year
description: Survey by Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development reveals the extent of the threat to white-collar workers from artificial intelligence
content:
It is the latest indicator of the impact AI poses to the jobs market, which is grappling with slower hiring since employment costs rose in last year’s budget.
